content: To override default styles, pass your own class names. For components without slots, use the `className` prop. For components with multiple parts (slots), use the `classNames` prop.

A slot is a part of a component that can be styled separately. For example, the `CircularProgress` component has slots like `track`, `indicator`, and `value`. You can style each one individually via the `classNames` prop.
You can use CSS Modules to override styles by importing your styles object and passing the generated class names to the component's `className` or `classNames` prop.
To use a CSS-in-JS library like `styled-components` or `emotion`, wrap the HeroUI component in the `styled()` function. You can use the `.attrs` method to pass down props like `classNames`.
